entry.title: You're a Computer Athlete (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Productivity

You're a Computer Athlete

You're likely a professional computer user – you should behave like the athlete that you are

entry.title: Using Tana's Supertags with Search (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Tana

Using Tana's Supertags with Search

Learn how to use Tana's supertags with live searches and create amazing workflows.

entry.title: Learn how to use Supertags in Tana (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Tana

Learn how to use Supertags in Tana

Understand the basics of how to use Tana's supertags.

entry.title: Using Tana's Live Search Feature (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Tana

Using Tana's Live Search Feature

Learn how to use Tana's live searches.

entry.title: Get oriented in Tana's UI (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Tana

Get oriented in Tana's UI

Get started with Tana by exploring its main UI and navigation features.

entry.title: Everything is a Node in Tana (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Tana

Everything is a Node in Tana

Learn how to use Tana's nodes.

entry.title: Data About Nodes - Fields and Tags in Tana (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Tana

Data About Nodes - Fields and Tags in Tana

Learn how to leverage Tana's fields and tags to record data about individual nodes.

entry.title: New Time Units for Higher Productivity (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Productivity

New Time Units for Higher Productivity

Our common measures of time never worked for me for time management. So I invented my own.

entry.title: The Input Channel Audit (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Atomic Essay: Attention Design

The Input Channel Audit

A quick How To guide for shaping your information diet

entry.title: Develop Strong Criteria for Input Triage (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Atomic Essay: Attention Design

Develop Strong Criteria for Input Triage

'How in the world. You need less Twitter in your life.' I had, again, discarded my guard rails of attention design and failed at input triage.

entry.title: The Seven Questions At The Heart Of Knowledge Ops (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Knowledge Ops

The Seven Questions At The Heart Of Knowledge Ops

Personal Knowledge Management is too restrictive – you want to think about all seven of these questions instead.

entry.title: The Grazing – Feeding Model of Information Gathering (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Knowledge Ops

The Grazing – Feeding Model of Information Gathering

On the Internet, information is limitless. The Grazing-Feeding Model of Information Gathering helps you know how you're engaging with that information.

entry.title: Sadly, Constraints Are Real (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Atomic Essay: Constraints

Sadly, Constraints Are Real

For the last 15 years I've ignored one fundamental truth: real constraints exist. Here's what I'm trying now.

entry.title: Adversarial Reading (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Algorithm of Thought

Adversarial Reading

Bullshit is everywhere, and these algorithms of thought help you do more adversarial reading.

entry.title: How to improve a process (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Atomic Essay: Productivity

How to improve a process

With taking notes as an example, let's talk about how to improve any process.

entry.title: Don't Fiddle With Your Note-Taking System (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Atomic Essay: Note-taking

Don't Fiddle With Your Note-Taking System

You should stick to one note-taking system and fiddle with it as little as possible. That's a myth.

entry.title: Get Rid of Peer Review and Academic Journals (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Peer Review

Get Rid of Peer Review and Academic Journals

Why to get rid of peer review and academic journals as we know them – and possibly what to do instead.

entry.title: You Actually Need to Context Switch (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Atomic Essay: Productivity

You Actually Need to Context Switch

Common wisdom says that you need to avoid context switching. That's only half true – sometimes you need to context switch.

entry.title: How to Context Switch Like a Pro (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Productivity

How to Context Switch Like a Pro

Context switching is unavoidable – but you can make it less costly by combining a couple of simple strategies.

entry.title: A Tale of Two Biases: How To Read The News (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Reading

A Tale of Two Biases: How To Read The News

Counter two frequent biases while reading the news: Selection Bias and Description Bias.

entry.title: How to use Roam Research for Interstitial Journaling (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Interstitial Journaling

How to use Roam Research for Interstitial Journaling

Interstitial Journaling is a great technique for minimizing context switching costs and staying productive. Here's how I use it in Roam Reserch.

entry.title: Why You Should Pick Zotero As A Reference Manager (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Academic Workflow

Why You Should Pick Zotero As A Reference Manager

A guide to reference managers, what you should expect from them and why Zotero is the reference manager you should use - whether you're in academia or not.

entry.title: Behavior First, Theory Second (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Learning

Behavior First, Theory Second

Behavior and Theory are two heuristics that can help you in deciding between courses and teachers.

entry.title: True Algorithms of Thought Have Arrived (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Algorithm of Thought

True Algorithms of Thought Have Arrived

Can you imagine being able to transfer 'mental software' between people? It's now possible, by using Algorithms of Thought in Roam Research.

entry.title: The Power of Keystone Habits with Roam Research (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Programming Attention

The Power of Keystone Habits with Roam Research

How to use Roam Research as your keystone habit to regularly revisit writing that is important to you, using the ∆ feature in Roam.

entry.title: Zotero and Roam Research (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Academic Workflow

Zotero and Roam Research

A guide for using Roam Research together with Zotero to get the most out of your citation metadata.

entry.title: A short (preliminary) guide to Spaced Repetition in Roam Research (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Spaced Repetition

A short (preliminary) guide to Spaced Repetition in Roam Research

How to use Roam Research's new Delta feature to do Spaced Repetition and never forget anything again.

entry.title: My grandfather's research technique - Index, Proto-Zettelkasten, Paper (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Zettelkasten

My grandfather's research technique - Index, Proto-Zettelkasten, Paper

My grandfather's way of doing history research before the computer age. Using paper and a meticulous process, he built something close to a Zettelkasten.

entry.title: How to cure Highlight Dementia (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Reading

How to cure Highlight Dementia

How to make sure that you never lose insights when reading and highlighting. Because Highlight Dementia is completely preventable.

entry.title: Actor's Concepts and Inventing Discovery (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Reading

Actor's Concepts and Inventing Discovery

How discovery became an actor's concept - and what you can use that for. Can you play chess without knowing that you are doing so?

entry.title: Getting Started with Algorithms of Thought (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Reading

Getting Started with Algorithms of Thought

An introduction to Algorithms of Thought - how they differ from Mental Models and how to use them in Roam Research.

entry.title: Universal-X - Of Polymaths and other fantastic creatures (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Polymathy

Universal-X - Of Polymaths and other fantastic creatures

There are words you can't use to describe yourself without sounding like an utter ass. Imagine asking someone at a party who they are and they respond with 'Nice to meet you, I'm a brilliant photographer/physicist/writer' - instant, life-long friends you'll be, no?

entry.title: The Right to Disagree (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Algorithm of Thought

The Right to Disagree

Contrary to popular belief, you can't just disagree with someone because you feel like it. You have to __earn__ the right to disagree with someone's position.

entry.title: A Gruvbox Theme for Roam Research (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Roam Research

A Gruvbox Theme for Roam Research

How to create a Gruvbox-style color theme for Roam Research using Roam's built-in CSS capabilities.

The structural basis for HIV-1 Vif antagonism of human APOBEC3G

  • A. D. Ashton

entry.title: Concerns about data linking delta land gain to human action (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Concerns about data linking delta land gain to human action

  • Florin Zăinescu
  • Edward Anthony
  • Florin Tătui
Matters Arising 08 Feb 2023

entry.title: Aberrant phase separation and nucleolar dysfunction in rare genetic diseases (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Aberrant phase separation and nucleolar dysfunction in rare genetic diseases

Frameshift mutations that create arginine-rich basic tails in transcription factors and other proteins can lead to altered phase separation in the nucleolus, which in turn leads to syndromes such as brachyphalangy, polydactyly and tibial aplasia.

  • Martin A. Mensah
  • Henri Niskanen
  • Denes Hnisz
Article Open Access 08 Feb 2023

entry.title: An E1–E2 fusion protein primes antiviral immune signalling in bacteria (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
An E1–E2 fusion protein primes antiviral immune signalling in bacteria

This study demonstrates that bacteria use a ubiquitin transferase-like enzyme to prime cGAS/DncV-like nucleotidyltransferase activation and use a deubiquitinase-like enzyme to decrease activity. 

  • Hannah E. Ledvina
  • Qiaozhen Ye
  • Aaron T. Whiteley
Article 08 Feb 2023

entry.title: Spin-polarized spatially indirect excitons in a topological insulator (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Spin-polarized spatially indirect excitons in a topological insulator

A topological insulator, Bi2Te3, has been found to have spatially indirect spin-polarized excitonic states, opening the prospect of combining exciton and topological physics.

  • Ryo Mori
  • Samuel Ciocys
  • Alessandra Lanzara
Article 08 Feb 2023

entry.title: TET2 guards against unchecked BATF3-induced CAR T cell expansion (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
TET2 guards against unchecked BATF3-induced CAR T cell expansion

Disruption of TET2 increases the antitumour efficacy of CAR T cells, but establishes an epigenetic state that is prone to hyperproliferation and accumulation of secondary mutations.

  • Nayan Jain
  • Zeguo Zhao
  • Michel Sadelain
Article 08 Feb 2023

entry.title: Extensive global wetland loss over the past three centuries (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Extensive global wetland loss over the past three centuries

We reconstruct the spatial distribution and timing of wetland loss through conversion to seven human land uses between 1700 and 2020, elucidating the magnitude and land-use drivers of global wetland losses to improve assessments of wetland loss impacts.

  • Etienne Fluet-Chouinard
  • Benjamin D. Stocker
  • Peter B. McIntyre
Article 08 Feb 2023

entry.title: A dense ring of the trans-Neptunian object Quaoar outside its Roche limit (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
A dense ring of the trans-Neptunian object Quaoar outside its Roche limit

The authors report observations of a dense and inhomogeneous ring at a surprisingly large distance from the trans-Neptunian body Quaoar.

  • B. E. Morgado
  • B. Sicardy
  • J. de Wit
Article 08 Feb 2023

entry.title: Water splitting with silicon p–i–n superlattices suspended in solution (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Water splitting with silicon p–i–n superlattices suspended in solution

The simplicity of particle suspension reactors and the precise synthetic control afforded by silicon nanowire growth are used to develop a system that can produce hydrogen fuel by splitting water with sunlight.

  • Taylor S. Teitsworth
  • David J. Hill
  • James F. Cahoon
Article 08 Feb 2023

entry.title: The cellular coding of temperature in the mammalian cortex (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
The cellular coding of temperature in the mammalian cortex

A study using calcium imaging in the mouse forepaw system identifies neurons in the posterior insular cortex that respond to cooling and/or warming with distinct response dynamics.

  • M. Vestergaard
  • M. Carta
  • J. F. A. Poulet
Article Open Access 08 Feb 2023

entry.title: Dissecting cell identity via network inference and in silico gene perturbation (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Dissecting cell identity via network inference and in silico gene perturbation

A machine-learning-based strategy called CellOracle combines computational perturbation with modelling of gene-regulatory networks to analyse how cell identity is regulated by transcription factors, and correctly predicts phenotypic changes after transcription factor perturbation in the developing zebrafish.

  • Kenji Kamimoto
  • Blerta Stringa
  • Samantha A. Morris
Article Open Access 08 Feb 2023

entry.title: Electrolyte design for Li-ion batteries under extreme operating conditions (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Electrolyte design for Li-ion batteries under extreme operating conditions

An electrolyte design strategy based on a group of soft solvents is used to achieve lithium-ion batteries that operate safely under extreme conditions without lithium plating and with the capability of fast charging.

  • Jijian Xu
  • Jiaxun Zhang
  • Chunsheng Wang
Article 08 Feb 2023

entry.title: Severe multi-year drought coincident with Hittite collapse around 1198–1196 bc (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Severe multi-year drought coincident with Hittite collapse around 1198–1196 bc

Tree-ring analysis is correlated with stable isotope data and historical texts to identify an unusual multi-year period of drought from around 1198 to 1196 bc associated with the collapse of the Hittite Empire.

  • Sturt W. Manning
  • Cindy Kocik
  • Jed P. Sparks
Article Open Access 08 Feb 2023

entry.title: Operando studies reveal active Cu nanograins for CO2 electroreduction (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Operando studies reveal active Cu nanograins for CO2 electroreduction

By investigation of structural dynamics during the life cycle of Cu nanocatalysts, correlation of multimodal operando techniques was found to serve as a powerful platform to advance understanding of their complex structural evolution.

  • Yao Yang
  • Sheena Louisia
  • Peidong Yang
Article 08 Feb 2023

entry.title: Telomere-to-mitochondria signalling by ZBP1 mediates replicative crisis (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Telomere-to-mitochondria signalling by ZBP1 mediates replicative crisis

Dysfunctional telomeres activate innate immune responses through mitochondrial TERRA–ZBP1 complexes to eliminate cells that are destined for neoplastic transformation.

  • Joe Nassour
  • Lucia Gutierrez Aguiar
  • Jan Karlseder
Article Open Access 08 Feb 2023

entry.title: Polygenic architecture of rare coding variation across 394,783 exomes (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Polygenic architecture of rare coding variation across 394,783 exomes

 An analysis of rare coding variants across 22 common traits and diseases indicates that these variants will contribute substantially to biological insights but modestly to population risk stratification.

  • Daniel J. Weiner
  • Ajay Nadig
  • Luke J. O’Connor
Article 08 Feb 2023

entry.title: A high-mass X-ray binary descended from an ultra-stripped supernova (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
A high-mass X-ray binary descended from an ultra-stripped supernova

A recently discovered high-mass X-ray binary has an evolutionary history showing the neutron star component formed during an ultra-stripped supernova, and has orbital elements that should allow for forming a binary neutron star in the future.

  • Noel D. Richardson
  • Clarissa M. Pavao
  • Jeremy Hare
Article 01 Feb 2023
